page.title: 01KIRKCONNEL,Dumfries-shire
page.content:
Kirkconnel lies astride the A76 in the North-west corner of Dumfries-shire. A one-time thriving coal-mining community it is now a much neglected back-water....hardly noticed by the passing traffic on this, the main route south from the industrial heart-land of neighbouring Ayrshire to Carlisle and beyond.The passengers viewing the beautiful{Upper-Nithsdale} scenery as they speed by in the comfort of B.R.Inter-city railway carriages heading for London,Glasgow or the Stranraer to Larne ferry will hardly even notice their brief stop at Kirkconnel's single platform station.
Kirkconnel's hey-days have long gone but the people's hopes are ever alive, ready for the time when employment may again be available to the many and not the few as it is today.
